author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: يا مالِكَ مَمالِكَ الإِنْشآءِ وَسُلْطَانَ الأَسْمآءِ بِأَنْ تَكْتُبَ اسْمِي مِنَ الَّذِينَ لَمْ يَزَلْ طَافُوا حَوْلَ سُرادِقِ مَجْدِكَ وَتَشَبَّثُوا بِذَيْلِ عِنايَتِكَ وَتَمَسَّكُوا بِحَبْلِ عُطُوفَتِكَ
translation: I entreat Thee, O Thou Who art the Ruler of the kingdoms of creation and the Author of all names, to write down my name with the names of them who, from eternity, have circled round the Tabernacle of Thy majesty, and clung to the hem of Thy loving-kindness, and held fast the cord of Thy tender mercy.
